title: Guinsoo's RageBlade need to be either removed or Phantom hit to cease to exist.

This item cause a balance mess on champion {{champion:67}} {{champion:11}} and any on hit abuser like {{champion:145}} . Vayne being able to fucking do  14% of max health true damave every 2 fucking auto need to get removed . WHO THINK THIS IS FUCKING HEALTHY?

It's easier to balance champion kit if they really need it than it is to balance an item for a wide diversity of champion..

Just because something's easier doesn't mean it's better. With balancing you need to target the source of the issue rather than the issue itself.

For example, if you want to stop drunk drivers from killing sober drivers, you wouldn't ban sober drivers from driving, you'd ban drunk drivers and put laws in place to prevent that. It's a similar line of reasoning here.

Only two (It was on Sated Devourer in Seasons 5 and 6, and on Rageblade in Season 6+)

Though imo, Phantom Hit isn't what made Sated Devourer unhealthy, it's the fact that it wasn't really punishable to sit in the jungle for 20 minutes and come out with Sated + {{item:3153}}, {{item:3748}} or old {{item:3124}} (when its passive was essentially a {{item:3077}}) because Sated having 50% AS and 60 on-hit damage as a base made it + one of the three above on-hit items all you really needed for damage.

Rageblade is healthier overall as a concept, but it's made a coveted effect that you had to satisfy a specific condition to unlock become something really easily accessible. I feel like if Phantom Hit was harder to access but not made exclusive to a specific class, it would be an okay mechanic.

As much as i agree that phantom hit breaks the game you have to understand why it exists.

Its basically the "IE" of on hit items, without it on hit would become trash again and only a early game stat (like it used to be).

Yes, and look what happened to IE, it's 50% amp for crits got first changed to something else and now it will return as 25% amp.
The idea of an on-hit amp is fine, but the tuneing is problematic, as 50% increase in power is just massive, and unlike crit, many kits have strong on-hit in their kit so they can rush rageblade for the amp, while only tryn has crit in his kit without other items.
Another refference would be Rabadons with the 40% increase, and again champs don't have base AP so it only interacts with stats from other items unlike phantom hit(exept veigar), and unlike crit or on-hit it AP does not have other multiplyers, while on-hit scales with AS and crit scales with AS and AD.

The high tuneing and the big variance of on-hit on different champs makes pohantomhit a big balance issue.
